title: ‘Hamilton’ Duels With ‘Hamilton’ Atop Cast Albums Chart, As ’10 Shots’ Debuts
summary: The Hamilton highlights album takes the stage and hits No. 1.
body: It’s rare that the original Broadway cast recording of Hamilton: An American Musical is not No. 1 on Billboard ’s weekly Cast Albums chart. (After all, it’s been No. 1 for 454 weeks out of the 528 it has been on the chart since its debut in 2015.) So when Hamilton is not No. 1 — as is the case this week — it’s notable. But the title that bumps Hamilton down to No. 2 this week is actually another album related to the show. A 10-song highlights edition, Hamilton: 10 Shots , arrives at No. 1 on the Nov. 15-dated chart , with 17,000 equivalent album units earned in the United States in the week ending Nov. 6, according to Luminate. Related ‘Hamilton’ Becomes First Cast Album to Log 500 Weeks on Billboard 200: 10 Cast Albums With the Longest Chart Runs Lin-Manuel Miranda Explains How ‘Hamilton’ Serves as a ‘Love Letter to Hip-Hop’ That He Grew Up On Inside GIRLSET's Push to Become K-Pop's Next Big Western Girl Group — and 'Slay Together' With KATSEYE The original Hamilton debuted at No. 1 on the Cast Albums chart dated Oct. 17, 2015, and has never left the chart. Hamilton: 10 Shots was issued as a strea…

title: Billboard’s Music Industry Events Calendar
summary: A complete rundown of the most important events across the music business.
body: As part of our continuing efforts to serve the music industry and its creators, Billboard Pro now features a music industry events calendar for readers. The calendar will act as music’s most complete summary major national and international industry events, from conferences to festivals to networking mixers and more. Just as Billboard is music’s must-read source for news, charts and analysis, now it also is the go-to for business happenings. Related Dates Announced for SXSW London Debut All-American Rejects to Open SXSW 2026, First 100 Showcasing Artists Announced Billboard's Live Music Summit Honors Khalid with VENU's Disruptor Award November 2025 Nov. 7-16 – New York Comedy Festival (New York) Nov. 9-11 – jump.global Annual Summit (Los Angeles) Nov. 11 –   Proud to Honor: A Benefit Concert Celebrating America’s Heroes (Nashville) Nov. 11 – Save the Music’s Hometown to Hometown Event (Nashville) Nov. 11 – Sony fiscal Q2 earnings call Nov. 12 – ASCAP Women Behind the Music (Los Angeles) Nov. 12 – Bloomberg Podcast Business Summit at On Air LA (Santa Monica, Calif.) title: Q3 2025 Earnings Roundup: Here’s What Every Music Company Made (Updating)
summary: A recap of every label, streamer and other major music company's third quarter earnings results.
body: A flurry of earnings reports for the quarter ended Sept. 30 show a continued divide in the music landscape. Live music companies such as Live Nation and MSG Entertainment posted double-digit growth as concert demand surged, while HYBE and SM Entertainment also benefitted from strong concert revenues. Streaming also spiked once again, pushing Spotify and Universal Music Group (UMG) to double-digit revenue growth. Legacy media didn’t fare as well, however: iHeartMedia revenue slipped slightly, while SiriusXM leveraged cost-cutting to compensate for flat revenue.  Here’s a running list, in alphabetical order, of the music companies that released earnings results (as of Nov. 11) for the quarter ended Sept 30, 2025.  Related Which Music Companies Had the Best Stock Returns in the Last Three Years? All-American Rejects to Open SXSW 2026, First 100 Showcasing Artists Announced Billboard's Live Music Summit Honors Khalid with VENU's Disruptor Award Cumulus Media : The radio company’s revenue fell 11.5% to $180.3 million and net loss grew to $20.4 million from $10.3 million in the prior-year quarter. The advertising business remains “challenging for lega…

title: Radio Earnings: iHeartMedia Revenue Down 1% in Q3, Cumulus and Townsquare Post Larger Losses
summary: Radio executives cited a “challenging” advertising market with “numerous headwinds” in their third-quarter earnings releases.
body: Radio companies had mixed results in the third quarter in their efforts to build digital businesses, cut costs and manage a decline in broadcast advertising dollars as consumers shift to newer entertainment platforms.    iHeartMedia’s consolidated revenue of $997 million was down just 1.1%, well within the company’s guidance of a low single-digit decline. Excluding the impact of political advertising in the prior-year period, revenue was up 2.8%. CEO Bob Pittman said during the company’s earnings call on Monday (Nov. 10) that the advertising environment is “pretty good” and iHeartMedia is “not feeling anything” related to the U.S. government shutdown.  Related Sony Music’s Quarterly Sales Surge 21% on Streaming, ‘Demon Slayer’ Success Billboard's Live Music Summit Honors Khalid with VENU's Disruptor Award Female Agents Have Come a Long Way, But There's Still Progress to Be Made: 'We Have to Continue to Fight for Each Other' An operating loss of $116 million stemmed from a $209 million impairment charge related to the value of iHeartMedia’s FCC licenses. Excluding the impact of the write-down and other extraordinary ite…

title: Tablets vs. Toys: Woody & Buzz Lightyear Face the Screen-Time Epidemic in First ‘Toy Story 5’ Teaser, Soundtracked by INXS
summary: The franchise's next installment will tackle how tablets are the toy of choice for a lot of modern kids.
body: Modern parents know all too well how difficult it can be to tear their kids and their tablets apart — and that’s exactly what the new Toy Story 5 teaser (soundtracked by INXS ) touches on. In a 50-second preview released by Pixar on Tuesday (Nov. 11), Woody, Buzz Lightyear, Mr. Potato Head and more of the franchise’s beloved toy characters tremble in fear as a frog-shaped tablet — named “Lilypad” — enters their household. Voiced by Greta Lee, the new piece of technology will make the “gang’s jobs exponentially harder when they have to go head to head with the all-new threat to playtime,” according to a description. Related INXS Top Triple J’s Inaugural ‘Hottest 100 of Australian Songs’ Poll Outkast Drops Collaboration With HOMAGE: Here's How to Buy the Collection Online How to Watch the L.A. Lakers vs. Oklahoma City Thunder Live Online With Sling TV The teaser also features the 1988 INXS hit “Never Tear Us Apart,” which reached No. 7 on the Billboard Hot 100 . The song’s romantic lyrics take on an eerie new meaning in the context of the movie premise, with the refrain — “Two w…

title: A$AP Relli Drops A$AP Rocky Shooting Lawsuit: ‘The Ordeal Has Been a Nightmare’
summary: The former A$AP Mob collaborators had been set to square off at a civil trial in early 2026, a year after Rocky was criminally acquitted of shooting Relli.
body: A$AP Relli has abandoned plans to retread his shooting claims against A$AP Rocky at a second trial early next year, telling Billboard through a lawyer that he’s instead “focusing on rebuilding his life.” Rocky (Rakim Mayers) was acquitted at a criminal trial this past February of shooting Relli (Terrell Ephron), his childhood friend and onetime A$AP Mob collaborator, in 2021. Relli brought an assault lawsuit in 2022 seeking financial damages from the star rapper over the same alleged incident. Related A$AP Rocky Opens Up About His Gun Assault Trial: ‘I Was Definitely Scared for My Freedom’ Billboard's Live Music Summit Honors Khalid with VENU's Disruptor Award Female Agents Have Come a Long Way, But There's Still Progress to Be Made: 'We Have to Continue to Fight for Each Other' The civil case was scheduled to go to trial in January, with Relli facing a lower burden of proof than the one prosecutors failed to meet in their criminal case against Rocky. But an attorney for Relli, Aaron Morris , tells Billboard on Tuesday (Nov. 11) that his client has decided to drop the assault claims. “At this point, he’s ready to simply move on from the sh…
